cgv.title: General Terms and Conditions of Sale
cgv.content:
These general terms and conditions of sale (GTC) apply to all sales made on the present Fi.Sweets website. They set out the rights and obligations of the Parties in the context of the sale of sweets on the Internet and are concluded between :
 on the one hand FI.Sweets with a capital of 1â‚¬, located at 13 rue romy Scneider, 94490 Ormesson sur marne.
 on the other hand, the Customer or any other person, individual or company, visiting or making a purchase via the Site (hereinafter referred to as the "Customer").
 The Company and the Client are referred to together as the "Parties".

accept.title: Acceptance of the general conditions of sale
accept.content:
The acceptance of these conditions is unconditional on the part of the Customer.
 The GTC are an integral part of our offer and are systematically brought to the attention of every Customer prior to placing an order. They shall prevail over any other conditions contained in any other document (information provided directly, advertising materials, descriptions, etc.).
 Any contrary condition opposed by the Client will be unenforceable against the Company, regardless of the time at which it may have been brought to our attention.
 No handwritten or electronic signature is required to commit the Client, the fact that the latter ticks the box "I have read the general terms and conditions of sale and I accept them" before validating his order automatically entails his express acceptance of these GTC.
 The applicable GTC are those in force on the day of the order placed by the Client. The Company reserves the right to modify these GTC without prior notice. These will then be applicable to sales made after the modification.

serviceAccess.title: Accessibility of services
serviceAccess.content:
The Website is accessible 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, unless it is interrupted, whether or not by the Company. The Company shall not be held responsible for any damage, of whatever nature, resulting from the unavailability of the Website.
 The provision of the Client's account does not give the Client any rights or create any obligations for the Company.
 The transmission of information via the Internet may not be totally secure. Although the Company takes all steps required by law to protect all Client information on its Website, the Company cannot guarantee that the transmission of data to our Website is secure. Such transmission is at the Client's risk.

customerService.title: Customer service and complaints
customerService.content:
For any questions or complaints, our customer service is at the disposal of our customers. We invite our customers to inform us of their complaints as soon as possible so that we can offer them a suitable solution. The means of contact are as follows:
 Mail: fi.sweets.94@gmail.com

products.title: Products and availability
products.content:
The Company prepares, markets online and delivers dishes for the benefit of individuals and companies. The Company's services are reserved for the Client, of legal age, for his own consumption. The resale of the products marketed by the Company is strictly forbidden
 The products offered for sale comply with the regulations and standards in force in France and/or the European Union on the date of their delivery. Each product is accompanied by a description enabling the Client to know its composition in accordance with Article L. 111-1, 1Â° of the Consumer Code.
 It is the Customer's responsibility to obtain information prior to any order, particularly in the event of food intolerance or allergies.
 The products are prepared by hand.
 The products are delivered cold. Their consumption may be deferred provided that the Use By date ("DLC") indicated on the packaging is respected and that they are kept in the refrigerator between 0Â° and 4Â°. It is the Client's responsibility to reheat the delivered products that require it according to the instructions and recommendations appearing on the Website.
 The Company shall not be held responsible in the event of poor storage conditions of the products after delivery, in the event of consumption after the use-by date or in any other case where the Client has not complied with the hygiene rules brought to its attention by the Company or by the health authorities.
 The Company reserves the right to modify the composition of a product, in particular depending on the availability of ingredients. It will inform the Clients concerned in advance, particularly in the event of a change in ingredients leading to the presence of an additional allergen. The Company undertakes to offer a suitable solution to the Client on request if he/she is inconvenienced by this substitution, including the replacement, insofar as possible and in any case until stocks are exhausted, or reimbursement of the modified products.
 The photographs and illustrations presented online are suggestions for presentation.
 The Company reserves the right to modify its offer at any time and without notice. Consequently, the products in our offer are available as long as they appear on the Site and within the limits of stocks. In the event of unavailability of the product after the order has been placed, the Client will be informed by e-mail, and no payment will be debited; if the payment has already been debited, it will be refunded.
 Certain products ordered by the Client may no longer be available on the scheduled delivery date due to unforeseeable events (e.g., gasoline shortage), climatic hazards, or the unavailability of products from suppliers for any other reason. In this case, the Company will inform the customer as soon as possible by e-mail, SMS or telephone and will propose an alternative solution or a total or partial refund of the order.

orders.title: Orders
orders.content:
To place an order, the Customer must create an account, choose a user name and a password, to be kept strictly confidential, to which he/she will associate his/her first name, surname, a precise delivery address and an operational mobile telephone number in order to allow the order to be delivered as soon as possible.
 To this end, the Client undertakes to provide sincere, true and up-to-date information at the time of placing the order. The Company shall not be held responsible for the consequences resulting from erroneous or incomplete data, in particular in the details of the recipient, the quantities and type of products ordered, or the account to be debited.
 The Company confirms the acceptance of the Client's order by e-mail.
 The Company reserves the right to request additional information from the Client, and to suspend an order in the event of alleged misuse of its services.
 The Company reserves the right not to proceed with an order in the event of any unforeseen event. In such circumstances, no costs will be charged to the Client. In this case, the Company will inform the Client by any means.
 The contractual information, presented to the Client in French, will be confirmed at the time of validation of the order.
 The Client is entirely responsible for the information provided when the order is registered. Consequently, our liability shall not be sought or incurred in the event that the Company is unable to deliver or execute the order due to errors, inaccuracies or omissions relating to this information.
 The Client who wishes to order one or more products must
 Log in by identifying himself when placing the order, or create a personal account.
 To do so, he/she must fill in the registration form and the delivery details on which he/she will indicate all the contact details requested.
 The Customer is also required to choose a password which must remain confidential and not be disclosed to a third party. The Customer remains responsible for the use of his/her account and password.
 Fill in the online shopping basket by selecting the products chosen
 Validate the order after having checked it, and in particular the place of delivery, as well as the date and time of delivery selected
 Make the payment in accordance with the conditions provided
 Confirm the order and payment
 Prior to the conclusion of the contract, the Company informs the Client, in accordance with Article L.221-5 of the Consumer Code, of the following
 Information on the essential characteristics of the product ordered by the Client
 The price of the product and the terms of payment
 The delivery costs according to the delivery address and the chosen delivery time slot
 The date of availability or delivery of the product
 Information about the Company, in particular its postal and telephone details
 The information that the Client does not benefit from the right of withdrawal on perishable products
 The assumption of responsibility by you for the cost of returning non-perishable products in the event that you exercise your right of withdrawal
 A reminder of the existence of a legal guarantee of conformity for the products
 Information on after-sales service and commercial guarantees
 The conditions for terminating the contract
 The total amount of the order (price before tax, price including tax, shipping costs or the indication that there are no shipping costs).

orderControl.title: Order control
orderControl.content:
In order to prevent fraudulent use of payment methods, Customer accounts and delivery addresses, and to strengthen the security of Customer transactions, the Company reserves the right to carry out checks on orders placed by its Customers.
 The Company may therefore ask each Client to send it documents proving the authenticity of its identity and/or domicile (identity card, proof of domicile such as an electricity or fixed telephone bill), whether the Client is a natural or legal person.
 In the context of these checks, if the supporting documents are not sent to the Company or if the documents sent do not make it possible to establish with certainty the identity of the person placing the order and the reality of the address, the Company reserves the right not to validate the order.
 The supporting documents will only be kept for the time required to process the Client's request.

prices.title: Prices
prices.content:
The prices of the products, expressed in euros and including all taxes but excluding delivery and transport costs, taking into account the VAT rate applicable on the day of the order, are those in force. The Company reserves the right to modify the prices at any time.
 The products will be invoiced on the basis of the tariff in force at the time of the order. Delivery costs, when applicable, are indicated in the order summary under the heading "delivery costs".

payment.title: Payment and non-payment
payment.content:
The price is payable in cash on the day the order is validated by the Customer.
 Payment is made either : 
 by credit card (Carte Bleue, Visa, Mastercard, Amex) via our Stripe payment platform, in a secure environment using a data encryption process that ensures confidentiality 
 via Paypal
 in cash
 each of which actively participates in the security of the transactions.
 The amount subject to payment is equal to the amount of the order minus the amount of the discounts granted by the Company at the time of the order. 
 Payment is therefore made directly between the Client and the payment platform. The information transmitted by the Client from his/her computer is not shared with the Company's employees or with third parties.
 The contact details can be saved with the acceptance of the Client, which means that the Client will not need to communicate this information for each new order. The payment will be debited to the already stored payment method of his/her choice.
 In the event of refusal by the bank payment centre concerned, the order will be automatically refused. In case of non-validated payment, the Client must contact his bank and/or the Company's customer service.
 In the event of unpaid orders, the order will be cancelled.

discounts.title: Discounts
discounts.content: Specific offers may be put in place within the framework of commercial agreements with certain partners. These are subject to special conditions and allow certain customers to benefit from discounts on their bill (delivery costs or products) according to specific contractually defined terms.

complianceOnDelivery.title: Compliance on delivery
complianceOnDelivery.content:
It is the customer's responsibility to check the products at the time of delivery. Consequently:
 In the event of missing or damaged products, the client must make all necessary observations upon receipt of the products to the Company's Customer Service Department so that a solution can be found as soon as possible.
 In the event of non-conformity of the products delivered in relation to the products ordered, the Client must formulate his/her complaints in writing, as soon as he/she is able to do so, upon receipt of the products to the Company.
 The communication channels have been specified in the Customer Service and Complaints section.

sponsorship.title: Sponsorship
sponsorship.content:
The Company offers its Customers the opportunity to sponsor their friends and close circles to introduce them to the service offered. Each Customer who has placed a first order has a referral code that he/she can share with his/her friends.
 At the time of their first order, new Customers have the possibility of entering a sponsorship code allowing them to benefit from a promotion. This sponsorship code cannot be combined with any other promotion. It is only valid if the new Customer has never previously ordered from the Site.
 The purpose of sponsorship is to introduce the Site to friends and family. A Customer may sponsor up to 25 friends. Beyond that number, he will no longer earn sponsorship credit. As soon as the order of a sponsored person has been validated, the sponsored Customer benefits from a sponsorship credit which will be added to his Kitty. This credit expires 365 days after its creation.
 A Customer may sponsor any person with whom he/she has a personal link. The Client agrees not to sponsor himself or herself or to misuse this feature.
 The Company reserves the right to suspend an account or unilaterally cancel the sponsorship credit(s) and the promotion resulting from the sponsorship in the event that it has been earned as a result of an error, fraud or in violation of these conditions.

rightOfWithdrawal.title: Right of withdrawal
rightOfWithdrawal.content: ConformÃ©ment aux dispositions de lâ€™article VI.73, 4Â° du Code de droit Ã©conomique, le droit de rÃ©tractation applicable en matiÃ¨re de vente Ã  distance ne peut Ãªtre exercÃ© dans le cas de la fourniture de biens qui, du fait de leur nature, sont susceptibles de se dÃ©tÃ©riorer ou de se pÃ©rimer rapidement. En application de ce texte, il est expressÃ©ment indiquÃ© que toute commande est ferme et dÃ©finitive et que lâ€™exercice du droit de rÃ©tractation est exclu. Le produit livrÃ© ne peut Ãªtre ni repris, ni Ã©changÃ©.

guarantee.title: Guarantee
guarantee.content:
The Customer benefits from the legal guarantee of conformity and the legal guarantee against hidden defects on the products sold, subject to a complaint being made to the Customer Service Department.
 The Customer remains solely responsible for the choice of products and their conservation. Any guarantee is excluded in the event of negligence, lack of maintenance on the part of the Client (particularly with regard to compliance with the cold chain) or in the event of an event of force majeure. The Company shall not be held liable if the non-execution or poor execution of an order is attributable to the Client, or linked to technical constraints beyond the Company's control.

personalData.title: Collection and processing of personal data
personalData.content:
The Client's personal data is subject to automated processing for the purposes of managing and monitoring the Client and prospective Client relationship, prospecting and sales promotion and managing the contractual relationship between the Company and each Client.
 The information we collect comes from
 the registration of the e-mail address of each Client allowing them to receive the newsletter. The Client can unsubscribe from the newsletter at any time by clicking on the link entitled "unsubscribe" which appears on each newsletter
 the complete entry of each Client's details in the order form (surname, first name, email address, telephone number, etc.) so that the order can be processed
 correspondence sent to the Company and its partners in order to be able to process the requests resulting from this correspondence
 the use of each Client's computer by memorising information automatically transmitted by the Client when using the Site (in particular: cookies and IP address). The Company collects information on the use made by each Client of the Site in order to obtain statistics, in particular, on the number of visitors to the Site and to personalise and optimise the content, layout and services offered on the Site.
 Personal data is used exclusively for the purposes mentioned above and approved by each Client. The main purpose of collecting personal data is to provide safe, efficient and personalised services.
 The information collected may be communicated to third parties linked to the Company by contract for the execution of subcontracted tasks necessary for the management of your profile. It will not be used for any other purpose in this context.
 The personal information collected is intended for the Company, which is responsible for processing it, and may be transmitted to our commercial partners if you have ticked the box authorising such transmission. The Company will not share your personal data with third parties unless you have expressly given your consent or the Company is under a legal obligation to do so.
 These third parties will be required to use your personally identifiable information only in connection with the services they provide to the Company.
 Finally, in the event of a merger or acquisition of the Company, personal information may be transferred to the acquiring company or purchaser after customers have been notified by email and by explicit notice on the Site.
 Personally identifiable information collected in the context of the use of the Site may be stored in Ile de France or in any country ensuring an adequate or sufficient level of protection of the privacy and fundamental rights and freedoms of individuals. By using the Site, each Client expressly agrees to the transfer to France and elsewhere of personally identifiable information provided to the Company.
 In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) of 27 April 2016 (RGPD), each Client has the right to access, question, modify, rectify and delete data concerning him/her, as well as the right to object on legitimate grounds. 
 The Company shall archive the order forms and invoices which shall constitute reliable copies resulting from an identical reproduction of the form and content of each order form and invoice.

properties.title: Intellectual and industrial property
properties.content: All texts, comments, works, illustrations, distinctive signs, databases and images reproduced on the Site are protected by intellectual property rights. Any use or reproduction, in whole or in part, on any medium and for any purpose, without the prior and express consent of the Company, is prohibited and may result in legal action for infringement.

applicableLaw.title: Applicable law
applicableLaw.content: These GTC are governed by French law. In the event of a dispute, the Client shall first contact the Company in order to find an amicable solution within one month. Failing this, jurisdiction is given to the competent courts of Paris.

nullity.title: Nullity
nullity.content: The nullity of a contractual clause of the present contract does not entail the nullity of the whole of the present contract, the clauses not cancelled retaining their full effect. The clause in question, or part of it, shall be deemed automatically replaced by one or more valid and enforceable provisions that come as close as possible to the original intention of the Company and the Client.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.content:
FI sweets builds strong and lasting relationships with its customers, partners and consumers, based on mutual trust: ensuring the security and confidentiality of their personal data is an absolute priority for FI sweets.
FI sweets complies with all French and European regulations and legislation relating to the protection of personal data.
FI sweets applies an extremely strict confidentiality policy to guarantee the protection of the personal data of users of its websites and other applications:
Each user remains in control of his or her data. It is treated transparently, confidentially and securely.
FI sweets is committed to a continuous approach to the protection of its users' data, in compliance with the French Data Protection Act of 6 January 1978 (hereinafter "LIL") and the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) of 27 April 2016 (hereinafter "GDPR").

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version).

definition.title: Definition
definition.content:
"Personal data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person; an "identifiable natural person" is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier, such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier, or to one or more factors specific to his or her physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity (hereinafter referred to as the "Data Subject").
"We" refers to the company FI sweets.
"Data controller" means the natural or legal person who determines the purposes and means of the processing.
"You" means any user/visitor of the Platform.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

subject.title: Purpose of the presentation
subject.content:
The protection of your Personal Information is very important to us.
We have developed this policy to inform you of the conditions under which we collect, process, use and protect your Personal Data. This policy applies in particular to Personal Data processed by FI sweets via the Platform. Please read this policy carefully so that you are aware of the categories of Personal Information that we collect and process, how we use that information and with whom we may share it. This policy also describes your rights and how you can contact us to exercise them or to ask any questions you may have about your Personal Information.

identity.title: Identity and contact details of the controller
identity.content: The person responsible for the processing is FI sweets, a company located at 13 rue romy scneider, Ormesson sur marne.

collect.title: Collection & origin of personal data
collect.content:
We may collect your Personal Data directly (in particular via the collection forms available on our Platform) or indirectly (in particular your employer and/or the technologies of our Platform).
We undertake to obtain your consent and/or to allow you to object to the use of your data for certain purposes, as soon as this is necessary. If necessary, you may withdraw your consent at any time in the relevant sections of the Platform's customer area.

dataType.title: Types of personal data

dataFinality.title: Purposes for which we use personal data in the context of our work experience

finality.title: Purpose of the processing
finality.one: Manage and process requests to create and manage accounts on the Platform
finality.two: Provide the services ordered on the Platform
finality.four: Allow you to consult your balance and/or your history, your consumption
finality.five: Provide you with offers for our products and services, send you newsletters, etc.
finality.six: Share profile data with third-party partners for the purpose of targeting advertising to similar profile audiences
finality.eight: To personalise and improve your experience on our Platform
finality.nine: To store your payment details with one of our secure payment providers to facilitate your future transactions on the Platform
finality.ten: Keeping data on your food preferences to personalise your orders
finality.eleven: Keeping invoice data for tax and accounting audits

legacy.title: Legal basis
legacy.one: The execution and management of our contractual relationship with you and/or our client (your employer)
legacy.two: The execution and management of our contractual relationship with you and/or our client (your employer)
legacy.three:
The performance and management of our contractual relationship with you and/or our client (your employer)
Our legitimate interest in improving the quality and operational excellence of the services we offer you
legacy.four: The performance and management of our contractual relationship with you and/or our client (your employer
legacy.five:
Our legitimate interest in improving the quality and operational excellence of the services we offer you
Your consent to receive offers from our partners
legacy.seven: Our legitimate interest in improving the quality and operational excellence of the services we offer you
legacy.eight: Our legitimate interest in improving the quality and operational excellence of the services we offer you

duration.title: Duration of data retention
duration.one: Up to 12 months from the last activity or immediately following the processing of the request to delete the account
duration.two: Up to 5 years from the end of our contractual relationship with your employer
duration.three: Up to 3 years after the last contact
duration.five:
For existing customers : Up to 12 months from the last activity or immediately following the processing of the account deletion request
For prospects: up to 3 years after the last contact from them
duration.six: Up to 12 months from the last activity or immediately following the processing of the request to delete the account
duration.seven: Up to 12 months from the last activity or immediately following the processing of the request to delete the account
duration.eight: Up to 12 months from the last activity or immediately following the processing of the request to delete the account

dataDuration.title: How long your personal data is kept
dataDuration.content:
We will retain your Personal Data for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which it is collected and processed (see table above).
At the end of this period, strictly relevant data may be kept (i) for evidential purposes (in the event of litigation or in the event of an inspection by authorised bodies), (ii) for the purposes of complying with legal or regulatory limitation periods and/or (iii) to comply with a contractual obligation with our customers.

dataCommunication.title: Communication of personal data
dataCommunication.content:
We restrict access to your Personal Information to those of our staff who need to know that information in order to process your request or provide you with the requested service.
We do not disclose your Personal Information to unauthorised third parties. We may, however, share your data with :
our customers in the performance of a contractual obligation;
FI sweets' business partners (with your prior consent).
We ensure that these recipients implement appropriate security and confidentiality measures to ensure that your Personal Data is protected.
We do not authorise these recipients to use or disclose your Data except to the extent necessary to perform services on our behalf or to comply with legal obligations. In addition, we may share Personal Data about you (i) if we are required to do so by law or legal process, (ii) in response to a request from any public authority, or (iii) if we consider that the disclosure of such data is necessary or appropriate to protect the safety of individuals or the public and to protect our rights and property and those of our customers.

info.title: Personal information and minors
info.content:
The Platform is intended for adults who are capable of entering into obligations in accordance with the legislation of the country in which you are located.
In France, a minor User under 15 years of age or incapable must obtain the prior consent of his legal guardian before entering his data on the Platform.

dataTransfer.title: Transfers of personal data
dataTransfer.content: In order to guarantee the security and confidentiality of Personal Data transferred in this way, we take all necessary steps to ensure that such data is adequately protected, such as signing the European Commission's Standard Contractual Clauses or any other mechanism ensuring an equivalent level of protection.

rights.title: Your rights
rights.label: According to the applicable law you have certain rights regarding the processing of your Personal Data.

accessRights.title: Right of access
accessRights.content:
You may request access to your Personal Data. You may also request that inaccurate Personal Data be corrected or that incomplete data be completed.
You also have the right to know the sources of this Personal Da

content.label: Your right to be forgotten allows you to request the deletion of Personal Data when :
content.one: the data are no longer necessary for the purposes for which they were collected and processed;
content.two: you choose to withdraw your consent (in cases where your consent has been collected as the legal basis for the processing) as this withdrawal does not affect the lawfulness of the processing prior to its implementation;
content.four: your data have been processed unlawfully ;
content.five: your data must be deleted to comply with a legal obligation; or
content.six: their removal is required to ensure compliance with current legislation.

content.label: You may also request a restriction on the processing of your Personal Data if :
content.one: you dispute the accuracy of the data;
content.two: we no longer need the data for the purposes of processing; and
content.three: you have objected to the processing of the data.

messageRights.title: Right to object to direct marketing messages
messageRights.content:
You may at any time ask us not to receive any further advertising or marketing by contacting us directly and free of charge, or by using the unsubscribe link included in any marketing that we may send to you by e-mail or by sending an e-mail to the address indicated below. This opposition is without prejudice to the legality of mailings made prior to its implementation.
In accordance with article L.223-2 of the French Consumer Code, the User is informed of his right to register free of charge on the opposition list to telephone canvassing (www.bloctel.gouv.fr).

autoRights.title: Right not to be subject to a decision based exclusively on automated data processing
autoRights.content: You have the possibility not to be subject to a decision based exclusively on automated Processing that produces legal effects concerning you or significantly affects you.

content.label: You may ask us to provide you with your Personal Data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format, or you may request that it be "ported" directly to another controller provided that:
content.one: the processing is based on your consent or the performance of a contract with you; and
content.two: that it is carried out by automated means.

deathRights.title: Right to issue advance directives on the processing of your Personal Data after your death
deathRights.content: In accordance with the French law on the protection of personal data, you can also define directives on the exercise of your rights under this section after your death, (in particular on their retention period, deletion and/or communication) as well as designate a person responsible for the exercise of these rights.

claimRights.title: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority
claimRights.content:
If you have any concerns or complaints regarding the protection of your Personal Data, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des LibertÃ©s via the following link: www.cnil.fr.
You can send us any request in advance by contacting us at the address indicated below so that we can deal with your request and find an amicable solution.

table.text: To exercise these rights, you can send your request by email to fi.sweets.94@gmail.com indicating your name, first name and the subject of your request. We may ask you for additional information in order to identify you and to be able to process your request.

security.title: Security
security.content:
We implement all technical and organisational measures to ensure the security and confidentiality of the processing of Personal Data.
In this respect, we take all the necessary precautions, with regard to the nature of the Personal Data and the risks presented by the processing, in order to preserve the security of the data and, in particular, to prevent them from being distorted, damaged or accessed by unauthorised third parties (physical protection of the premises, authentication procedures with personal and secure access via confidential identifiers and passwords, logging of connections, encryption of certain data etc.).

links.title: Links to other sites
links.content: We occasionally provide links to other websites for your convenience and information. These sites operated by third parties may have their own privacy policies or terms of use, which we strongly suggest you review. We are not responsible for the content of these sites, for any products or services that may be offered on them, or for any other use.

updatePrivacy.title: Update of our privacy policy
updatePrivacy.content:
We may update or modify this policy from time to time if our business or legal obligations change in a material way. In the event that we make significant changes to this policy, we will post a notice on our Platform at the time the changes take effect. Please check this page regularly for changes.
If you have any questions or comments regarding this policy, please contact us at fi.sweets.94@gmail.com .
